---
title: "scale_shape"
output: html_document
---

Maps discrete variables to six easily discernible shapes.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(rvest);library(xml2);library(httr)
library(ggplot2)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  class.output  = "bg-light"
)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
url <- "https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/scale_shape.html"
uastring <- "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.190 Safari/537.36"
session <- html_session(url, user_agent(uastring))
s <- html_text(html_nodes(session, xpath = "//*[@class='input']"))
s <- unlist(strsplit(s, split = '\n', fixed = TRUE))
```

```{r example1, echo=F}
z <- s[c(1,3)]
d <- eval(parse(text = z))
```

```{r, echo=F, comment=NA}
writeLines(z)
write(z, "./scale_shape/example1.R")
```

```{r}
plotly::ggplotly(d)
```

```{r example2, echo=F}
y <- s[c(1,3)]
z <- s[4]
z_1 <- paste("p <- ", z)
p <- eval(parse(text = c(y,z)))
```

```{r, echo=F, comment=NA}
writeLines(c(y,z_1))
write(c(y,z_1), "./scale_shape/example2.R")
```

```{r}
plotly::ggplotly(p)
```
